segments.en: Linked Discourses 4
1. Life Span
5. Māra’s Snares (2nd)

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṃ viharati isipatane migadāye.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.
There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
“Mendicants!”
“Venerable sir,” they replied.
The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “Muttāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sabbapāsehi ye dibbā ye ca mānusā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I am freed from all snares, both human and divine.

segments.pli: Tumhepi, bhikkhave, muttā sabbapāsehi ye dibbā ye ca mānusā.
segments.en: You are also freed from all snares, both human and divine.

segments.pli: Caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṃ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ.
segments.en: Wander forth, mendicants, for the welfare and happiness of the people, out of compassion for the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.
Let not two go by one road.

segments.pli: Desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāsetha.
segments.en: Teach the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

segments.pli: Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti.
segments.en: There are beings with little dust in their eyes. They’re in decline because they haven’t heard the teaching.
There will be those who understand the teaching!

segments.pli: Ahampi, bhikkhave, yena uruvelā senānigamo tenupasaṅkamissāmi dhammadesanāyā”ti.
segments.en: I will travel to Uruvelā, the village of Senāni, in order to teach the Dhamma.”

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha and addressed him in verse:
“You’re bound by all snares,
both human and divine.
You’re bound by the great bond:
you won’t escape me, ascetic!”
“I’m freed from all snares,
both human and divine.
I’m freed from the great bonds;
You’re beaten, terminator!”

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā … pe … tatthevantaradhāyīti.
segments.en: Then Māra … vanished right there.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Benares,…

suttaplex.blurb: When the Buddha explains to the mendicants how he has realized freedom, and so have his mendicant followers, Māra claims he is still trapped.
